titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Ham, Judgment
CWG11342

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Marion Circuit Court
May Term 1862.
Comonwealth Plff
vs } No 1 } On Indictement for Selling whiskey to Soldiers
John Ham Deft

This day came the attorney for the commonwealth. And Leo Beaven J H. Kirk D B Hampson Joseph Walrton Wriah G R L McElroy Jo F Douglass Redmond Prewett James Avrit Frank Ford. H Johnson & W W Hamilton were sworn to try the cause, and after hearing the evidence retired and returned into court the following verdict towit: We of the jury fine the defendant guilty of the offence charged in the within indictment and assess his fine at ten dollars J H Kirk one of the jury It is therefore adjudged that Said defendant make his fine to the commonwealth by the payment of ten dollars the amount by the jury in their verdict aforesaid assessed and also the costs herein expended

A copy attest
N. T. Berry Ck
